title: Bioplarch

author: Esen Gökçe Özdamar, Namik Kemal University (NKU)

segmentation: Good afternoon everybody, and I I'm assuming you've chosen Mar from by a pledge team.
First of all, I want to thank to police University who invited and coordinated this workshop and also to future architectures.

Platform, an festival organized organization organizations as well and also to Zach, which is the national Building and Civil Engineering Institute in Ljubljana and also to my participants who made this workshop possible.
Well, actually, before presenting the results of the workshop, first I want to tell about something about.

I applaud John bioplastic materials because it's an actually interdisciplinary research project that we are now conducting at Norma Kamali University at Insecure Doll, and actually we want to understand how we can combine bioplastic in architecture at the same time so other researchers in this project is Amit Ball from civil engineering, Sharma shattered from architecture Department and more fetishes professor from Chemistry Department at our University.

Well, as we know that plastics have been one of the most highly valued materials in our society because of their extraordinary versatility and low cost and their usage span a wide range of applications from packaging to building materials from consumer products to agricultural materials, biomedical devices and everything and everywhere, and also Roland parts once told that in his book mythology is that plastics are America's object and it's an alchemy or actually he was really true.
But however, the spread use of plastic in years over over the years have resulted as municipal solid waste.
As we know today.
And almost, at least, conventional plastics are made from petroleum based, and there it's a light components and it takes millions of years of these resources to form.
But we assume on being spread break this cycle very shortly.
So I think this is a point.
We should stop and start asking questions again.
